title: RHealth Medical Code Module

title: RHealth Medical Code Module
text: package automatically downloads required medical code datasets (CSVs) caches locally faster offline use. Uses rappdirs find user-specific cache directory. download_medcode() function checks cache first; downloads file missing. Let‚Äôs see data /cached:
code: # Get the platform-specific cache directory path cache_dir <- rappdirs::user_cache_dir("RHealth", "medcode") print(paste("Data cache directory:", cache_dir))

title: RHealth Medical Code Module
text: (step ensures data file exists locally, downloading necessary)
code: # Specify the dataset name (e.g., "ICD9CM") dataset_name <- "ICD9CM"  # Call the function - returns path. Downloads ONLY if not cached. # NOTE: For a live demo, ensure network access OR pre-cache the file! #       We assume it's pre-cached here. file_path <- download_medcode(name = dataset_name)  print(paste("Path for", dataset_name, ":", file_path)) print(paste("File exists:", fs::file_exists(file_path)))

title: RHealth Medical Code Module
text: load_medcode() function used internally functions (lookup_code, get_ancestors, etc.). first calls download_medcode() ensure data file available locally. , reads CSV file R data frame (tibble) using readr::read_csv. Example: Loading ICD9CM data
code: # Load the data using the function # This implicitly calls download_medcode first icd9_data_example <- load_medcode("ICD9CM")  # Confirm data is loaded by checking dimensions and showing first few rows print(paste("Loaded ICD9CM - Dimensions:", paste(dim(icd9_data_example), collapse = " x "))) print("First few rows:") kable(head(icd9_data_example))

text: function navigates code hierarchy upwards find parent ancestor codes. Example: Find ancestors ICD-9-CM code ‚Äú428.22‚Äù (Systolic heart failure, acute chronic)

title: Descriptions
text: Every dataset described single YAML file. file_path ‚Äì relative root HTTP(S) URL. patient_id ‚Äì column containing subject identifier. timestamp ‚Äì single column list columns (concatenated). attributes ‚Äì columns expose; automatically renamed table/column. join ‚Äì optional list auxiliary tables merge one pass. Load & validate R:
code: version: "1.4" tables:   admissions:     file_path: "ADMISSIONS.csv.gz"     patient_id: "subject_id"     timestamp: "admittime"     attributes:       - hadm_id       - admission_type       - discharge_location     join:       - file_path: "ICUSTAYS.csv.gz"         on: hadm_id         how: left         columns: [icustay_id, first_careunit] cfg <- load_yaml_config("configs/mimic4_ehr.yaml") print(cfg)

title: Descriptions

title: Descriptions
code: # Skeleton for your own task ---------------------------------------------- MyCoolTask <- R6::R6Class(   "MyCoolTask",   inherit = BaseTask,   public = list(     initialize = function() {       super$initialize(         task_name     = "MyCoolTask",         input_schema  = list(labs = "timeseries",                              diagnoses = "sequence"),         output_schema = list(outcome = "binary")       )     },      pre_filter = function(df) {       # keep only labs & diagnoses to save RAM       df$select(pl$col(c("labevents/valuenum",                          "diagnoses_icd/icd_code",                          "timestamp",                          "patient_id",                          "event_type")))     },      call = function(patient) {       # ... build samples here ...     }   ) )

title: Descriptions
text: BaseDataset$set_task(task) RHealth: Reads task$input_schema / task$output_schema. Calls get_processor(type) instantiate matching Processor (TimeseriesProcessor, SequenceProcessor, ‚Ä¶). sample emitted task$call() encoded fly torch_tensors stored SampleDataset. means never import torch inside task ‚Äì stick base R objects (numeric, character, matrix, data.frame, lists).

title: Descriptions
text: TimeseriesProcessor normalization: TimeseriesProcessor automatically applies z-score normalization timeseries data: - Computes feature-wise mean standard deviation training data fit() - Applies (x - mean) / std process() samples (train/val/test) - Prevents data leakage using training statistics

title: Descriptions
text: drop‚ÄëGRU/LSTM/RNN layer : 1‚Äëbased index safety (important R!). mask support can mix sequences different length. learnable null_hidden vector empty sequences (avoids NaNs). Bidirectional option automatic hidden‚Äëstate merging.

title: Descriptions
text: One RNNLayer per input feature (diagnoses, procedures, labs ‚Ä¶). Hidden vectors concatenated ‚Üí nn_linear ‚Üí logits. Works ‚Äë‚Äë‚Äëbox binary / multi‚Äëclass / regression tasks. Instantiation:
code: inputs  ‚îÄ‚ñ∂  EmbeddingModel  ‚îÄ‚ñ∂  per‚Äëfeature RNNLayer  ‚îÄ‚îê                                                       ‚îú‚îÄ‚ñ∂ concat ‚îÄ‚ñ∂ FC ‚îÄ‚ñ∂ logits labels   ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò model <- RNN(   dataset       = samples,     # a SampleDataset from `set_task()`   embedding_dim = 128,   hidden_dim    = 128 )

title: Descriptions
text: Subclass BaseModel (another concrete model). Add layers initialize(), making sure call super$initialize(dataset). Implement forward(inputs). Checklist: Call super$initialize(dataset) Use self$get_output_size() instead hard‚Äëcoding dimensions Return named list containing least loss, y_prob
code: MyDense <- torch::nn_module(   "MyDense",   inherit = BaseModel,    initialize = function(dataset, hidden = 256) {     super$initialize(dataset)     in_dim  <- sum(purrr::map_int(dataset$input_processors, "size"))     out_dim <- self$get_output_size()     self$fc1 <- nn_linear(in_dim, hidden)     self$fc2 <- nn_linear(hidden, out_dim)   },    forward = function(inputs) {     # Flatten and concat all features     x <- torch::torch_cat(purrr::flatten(inputs), dim = 2)     logits <- self$fc2(torch_relu(self$fc1(x)))      list(       loss   = self$get_loss_function()(logits, inputs[[self$label_keys]]$to(logits$device)),       y_prob = self$prepare_y_prob(logits)     )   } )

title: Descriptions
text: Trainer module provides batteries‚Äëincluded training loop RHealth model built torch. mirrors PyHealth‚Äôs Python trainer, bringing familiar conveniences R ecosystem: dynamic steps_per_epoch (loop dataloader indefinitely); smart weight‚Äëdecay parameter groups (skip bias / LayerNorm); automatic gradient clipping; experiment folders file logging via {futile.logger}; optional CLI progress bars (cli::cli_progress_bar()).

title: Descriptions
text: Logs & checkpoints:
code: library(RHealth)  ## 1.  Build dataset & task ----------------------------------------------- ds      <- MIMIC4Dataset$new(root = "~/mimic4",                              tables = c("patients", "admissions", "labevents"),                              config_path = system.file("configs/mimic4_ehr.yaml", package = "RHealth")) task    <- InHospitalMortalityMIMIC4$new(input_window_hours = 48) samples <- ds$set_task(task)  splits <- split_by_patient(samples, c(0.8, 0.1, 0.1)) train_dl <- get_dataloader(splits[[1]], batch_size = 32, shuffle = TRUE) val_dl <- get_dataloader(splits[[2]], batch_size = 32) test_dl <- get_dataloader(splits[[3]], batch_size = 32)  ## 2.  Build model --------------------------------------------------------- model <- RNN(samples, embedding_dim = 128, hidden_dim = 128)  ## 3.  Kick off training --------------------------------------------------- trainer <- Trainer$new(model,                        metrics      = c("roc_auc", "pr_auc"),                        output_path  = "experiments",                        exp_name     = "mortality_rnn")  trainer$train(               train_dataloader = train_dl,               val_dataloader = val_dl,               epochs = 10,               optimizer_params = list(lr = 1e-3),               monitor = "roc_auc") experiments/ ‚îî‚îÄ mortality_rnn/    ‚îú‚îÄ train.log    ‚îú‚îÄ last.ckpt      # after every epoch    ‚îî‚îÄ best.ckpt      # whenever AUROC improves

title: Descriptions
text: RHealth currently active development. initial phase focuses establishing two foundational modules: EHR Database Module: module developed provide standardized framework ingesting, processing, managing diverse Electronic Health Record (EHR) datasets. aims support public datasets like MIMIC-III, MIMIC-IV, eICU, well user-specific data formats OMOP-CDM. goal ensure data consistency subsequent modeling tasks. EHR Code Mapping Module (medcode): module, core medcode component, facilitates mapping within various medical coding systems (e.g., ICD, NDC, RxNorm). Key functionalities like code lookup, hierarchy navigation, cross-system mapping, ATC utilities already implemented, demonstrated examples . Looking ahead, development roadmap includes expansion RHealth several key modules enhancements: Healthcare DL Core Module: module integrate traditional machine learning models (e.g., Random Forests, Support Vector Machines) state---art healthcare-specific deep learning models (e.g., RETAIN, AdaCare, Transformers, graph networks, convolutional networks, recurrent networks). Prediction Task Module: module designed handle various clinical prediction tasks using EHR data, including patient-level predictions (e.g., mortality, disease risk), intra-visit predictions (e.g., length stay, drug recommendation), inter-visit predictions (e.g., readmission risk, future diagnoses). Support Multi-modal Data Integration: Enhancements handle integrate diverse data types beyond structured EHR data. Clinical Trial Applications: Developing functionalities support research analysis context clinical trials. Large Language Model (LLM) Enhancement: Exploring integration LLMs augment package capabilities. RHealth aims provide R community powerful user-friendly toolkit healthcare predictive modeling using deep learning. glad hear feedbacks suggestions via email submitting issues.

title: EHRShot Dataset Quick Start Guide
text: Use dev mode (dev = TRUE) development work subset 1000 patients Enable parallel processing num_workers parameter generating samples Use caching specifying cache_dir avoid regenerating samples Filter OMOP tables reduce feature space appropriate
code: # Example with performance optimizations dataset <- EHRShotDataset$new(   root = "/path/to/ehrshot",   tables = c("ehrshot", "splits", "guo_los"),   dev = FALSE )  task <- BenchmarkEHRShot$new(   task = "guo_los",   omop_tables = c("condition_occurrence", "procedure_occurrence", "drug_exposure") )  samples <- dataset$set_task(   task = task,   num_workers = 8,      # Use 8 parallel workers   cache_dir = "./cache" # Cache samples for reuse )

code: eicu_full <- eICUDataset$new(   root = "/path/to/eicu-crd/2.0",   tables = c(     "diagnosis",      # ICD-9 diagnoses with diagnosis strings     "medication",     # Medication orders with drug names     "lab",            # Laboratory measurements     "treatment",      # Treatment information     "physicalexam",   # Physical examination findings     "admissiondx"     # Primary admission diagnoses (APACHE)   ),   dev = FALSE  # Load full dataset )  eicu_full$stats()

title: Getting Started with eICU-CRD Dataset
code: # Get all patient IDs (ICU stay IDs) patient_ids <- eicu_full$unique_patient_ids() cat("Total ICU stays:", length(patient_ids), "\n")  # Get a specific patient's data patient <- eicu_full$get_patient(patient_ids[1]) print(patient)

title: Getting Started with eICU-CRD Dataset
text: eICU database three levels patient identification: uniquepid: Unique patient identifier (across multiple admissions) patienthealthsystemstayid: Hospital admission identifier patientunitstayid: ICU stay identifier (used primary ID RHealth)

title: Getting Started with eICU-CRD Dataset
text: timestamps eICU relative offsets minutes ICU admission time: Positive offsets: Events ICU admission Negative offsets: Events ICU admission (e.g., hospital stay) Zero: ICU admission time
code: # Example: View events with their offset timestamps events <- eicu_full$collected_global_event_df() head(events[, c("patient_id", "event_type", "timestamp")])

title: Getting Started with eICU-CRD Dataset
text: eICUDataset automatically handles .csv .csv.gz files. special configuration needed:
code: # Works with both patient.csv and patient.csv.gz eicu_gz <- eICUDataset$new(   root = "/path/to/eicu-crd/2.0",  # Can contain .csv.gz files   tables = c("diagnosis", "medication"),   dev = TRUE )

title: Getting Started with eICU-CRD Dataset
text: can provide custom YAML configuration file : Add custom tables Modify attributes extract Change join relationships
code: eicu_custom <- eICUDataset$new(   root = "/path/to/eicu-crd/2.0",   tables = c("diagnosis", "lab"),   config_path = "/path/to/custom_eicu_config.yaml",   dataset_name = "eicu_custom",   dev = TRUE )

title: Getting Started with eICU-CRD Dataset
text: Process patients custom analyses:
code: # Returns a list of Patient objects patients <- eicu_full$iter_patients()  # Example: Count events per patient event_counts <- sapply(patients, function(p) {   nrow(p$data_source) })  summary(event_counts)

title: Getting Started with eICU-CRD Dataset
code: # Get the full event dataframe all_events <- eicu_full$collected_global_event_df()  # Filter specific event types diagnoses <- all_events[all_events$event_type == "diagnosis", ] medications <- all_events[all_events$event_type == "medication", ] labs <- all_events[all_events$event_type == "lab", ]  # Summary by event type table(all_events$event_type)

title: Getting Started with eICU-CRD Dataset
text: eICUDataset can integrated task-specific processors various prediction tasks:

previous_headings: Integration with Prediction Tasks > Mortality Prediction
what: Option 1: Using ICD codes and standard features
title: Getting Started with eICU-CRD Dataset
code: # Load dataset with relevant tables eicu_mortality <- eICUDataset$new(   root = "/path/to/eicu-crd/2.0",   tables = c("diagnosis", "medication", "physicalexam"),   dev = FALSE )  # Define and set mortality prediction task mortality_task <- MortalityPredictionEICU$new() sample_dataset <- eicu_mortality$set_task(task = mortality_task)  # Split dataset splits <- split_by_patient(sample_dataset, c(0.8, 0.1, 0.1))  # Get dataloaders train_dl <- get_dataloader(splits[[1]], batch_size = 32, shuffle = TRUE) val_dl <- get_dataloader(splits[[2]], batch_size = 32) test_dl <- get_dataloader(splits[[3]], batch_size = 32)  # Build and train model model <- RNN(   dataset = sample_dataset,   embedding_dim = 128,   rnn_type = "GRU",   num_layers = 1 )  trainer <- Trainer$new(model = model) trainer$train(   train_dataloader = train_dl,   val_dataloader = val_dl,   epochs = 10,   monitor = "roc_auc" )  # Evaluate on test set results <- trainer$evaluate(test_dl) print(results)

title: A Deep Learning Toolkit for Healthcare Predictive Modeling
text: standalone module helps map medical codes different systems. Code Lookup: Find Ancestors/Descendants: Cross-System Mapping:
code: lookup_code(code = "428.0", system = "ICD9CM") # Get all parent codes get_ancestors(code = "428.22", system = "ICD9CM")  # Get all child codes get_descendants(code = "428", system = "ICD9CM") # Map from ICD-9 to CCS map_code(code = "428.0", from = "ICD9CM", to = "CCSCM") # Map from ICD-9 to ICD-10 map_code(code = "589", from = "ICD9CM", to = "ICD10CM")

title: A Deep Learning Toolkit for Healthcare Predictive Modeling
text: Dataset module foundation RHealth. transforms raw, multi-table Electronic Health Record (EHR) dumps tidy, task-ready tensors downstream model can consume. Key Features: Data Harmonisation: Merges heterogeneous tables single, canonical event table. Built-Caching: Uses DuckDB CSV ‚Üí Parquet caching, enabling 10x faster reloads. Dev Mode: Allows lightning-fast iteration using small subset patients. can download sample dataset (MIMIC-IV Demo, version 2.2) directly PhysioNet using following link: üëâ https://physionet.org/content/mimic-iv-demo/2.2/#files-panel Quick Start: Define dataset source files using YAML configuration.
code: # The YAML config defines tables, patient IDs, timestamps, and attributes # See the full documentation for details on the YAML structure.  # Load the dataset data_dir <- "/Users/yourname/datasets/mimiciv/"  ds <- MIMIC4EHRDataset$new(   root = data_dir,   tables = c("patients", "admissions", "diagnoses_icd", "procedures_icd", "prescriptions"),   dataset_name = "mimic4_ehr",   dev = TRUE )  ds$stats() #> Dataset : mimic4_ehr #> Dev mode : TRUE #> Patients : 1 000 #> Events   : 2 187 540

title: A Deep Learning Toolkit for Healthcare Predictive Modeling
text: Task module defines prediction problem. tells RHealth predict, data use, generate (input, target) samples patient‚Äôs event timeline. task defined subclassing BaseTask implementing call() method. Example Task Definition: Generating Samples: task defined, use dataset create SampleDataset compatible torch.
code: MyReadmissionTask <- R6::R6Class(   "MyReadmissionTask",   inherit = BaseTask,   public = list(     initialize = function() {       super$initialize(         task_name     = "MyReadmissionTask",         input_schema  = list(diagnoses = "sequence", procedures = "sequence"),         output_schema = list(outcome = "binary")       )     },     call = function(patient) {       # Your logic to generate samples for a single patient...       # This should return a list or list-of-lists with named fields       # matching the input/output schemas.              # Example:       # list(       #   diagnoses = c("401.9", "250.00"),       #   procedures = c("88.72"),       #   outcome = 1       # )     }   ) ) task    <- InHospitalMortalityMIMIC4$new() # A built-in task samples <- ds$set_task(task)

title: A Deep Learning Toolkit for Healthcare Predictive Modeling
text: Model module provides ready--use neural network architectures. models inherit BaseModel, automates dimension calculation, loss function selection, device management (CPU/GPU). Built-Models: RHealth includes reference implementations like RNN, can instantiated one line: Custom Models: can easily write model inheriting BaseModel.
code: model <- RNN(   dataset       = samples, # The SampleDataset from set_task()   embedding_dim = 128,   hidden_dim    = 128 ) MyDenseNet <- torch::nn_module(   "MyDenseNet",   inherit = BaseModel,   initialize = function(dataset, hidden_dim = 256) {     super$initialize(dataset) # IMPORTANT: handles schema setup          # Calculate input/output dimensions automatically     in_dim  <- sum(purrr::map_int(dataset$input_processors, "size"))     out_dim <- self$get_output_size()      self$fc1 <- nn_linear(in_dim, hidden_dim)     self$fc2 <- nn_linear(hidden_dim, out_dim)   },   forward = function(inputs) {     # Flatten and concatenate all input features     x <- torch::torch_cat(purrr::flatten(inputs), dim = 2)     logits <- self$fc2(torch_relu(self$fc1(x)))      # Return loss and probabilities     list(       loss   = self$get_loss_function()(logits, inputs[[self$label_keys]]),       y_prob = self$prepare_y_prob(logits)     )   } )

title: A Deep Learning Toolkit for Healthcare Predictive Modeling
text: Trainer module provides high-level, configurable training loop handles logging, checkpointing, evaluation, progress bars. Example Training Workflow: Logs model checkpoints (best.ckpt, last.ckpt) saved automatically experiments/mortality_rnn/.
code: # 1. Create data loaders splits <- split_by_patient(samples, c(0.8, 0.1, 0.1), stratify = TRUE, stratify_by = 'mortality') train_dl <- get_dataloader(splits[[1]], batch_size = 32, shuffle = TRUE) val_dl <- get_dataloader(splits[[2]], batch_size = 32) test_dl <- get_dataloader(splits[[3]], batch_size = 32)  # 2. Instantiate a model model <- RNN(train_dl, embedding_dim = 128, hidden_dim = 128)  # 3. Set up the trainer trainer <- Trainer$new(     model,     metrics     = c("auroc", "auprc"),     output_path = "experiments",     exp_name    = "mortality_rnn" )  # 4. Start training trainer$train(   train_dataloader = train_dl,   val_dataloader = val_dl,   epochs = 10,   optimizer_params = list(lr = 1e-3),   monitor = "roc_auc" )

title: A Deep Learning Toolkit for Healthcare Predictive Modeling
text: RHealth active development. roadmap includes: Healthcare DL Core Module: Adding SoTA models like RETAIN, AdaCare, Transformers. Prediction Task Module: Adding built-tasks common clinical predictions (e.g., length stay, readmission risk). Multi-modal Data: Enhancing support integrating imaging, genomics, clinical notes. LLM Integration: Augmenting package capabilities Large Language Models. welcome feedback contributions! Please submit issue GitHub contact maintainers.

title: BaseDataset ‚Äî R6 infrastructure for clinical event datasets ‚Äî BaseDataset
text: BaseDataset class mirrors rhealth's BaseDataset, providing fully-featured, YAML driven loader converts multi-table electronic health records single event table.  supports: URL local-file ingestion (automatic .csv / .csv.gz fallback). Per-table joins declared config. Flexible timestamp parsing (single multi-column). dev mode caps number patients rapid prototyping. Multi-threaded sample generation progress bars. -stream, cooperates BaseTask (task definition), Patient (per-subject wrapper), SampleDataset (collection input/output pairs).

text: Task class running benchmark evaluations EHRShot dataset. Supports multiple categories prediction tasks including operational outcomes, lab value predictions, new diagnoses, medical imaging findings.

title: BenchmarkEHRShot: Benchmark predictive tasks using EHRShot ‚Äî BenchmarkEHRShot
text: BenchmarkEHRShot task class implements predictive modeling tasks EHRShot benchmark. task uses clinical codes ehrshot table features generates predictions based task-specific labels. Operational Outcomes (Binary Classification): guo_los: Predicts length stay exceeds threshold guo_readmission: Predicts hospital readmission guo_icu: Predicts ICU admission Lab Values (Multiclass Classification): lab_thrombocytopenia: Predicts low platelet count severity lab_hyperkalemia: Predicts high potassium level severity lab_hypoglycemia: Predicts low blood sugar severity lab_hyponatremia: Predicts low sodium level severity lab_anemia: Predicts anemia severity New Diagnoses (Binary Classification): new_hypertension: Predicts new hypertension diagnosis new_hyperlipidemia: Predicts new hyperlipidemia diagnosis new_pancan: Predicts new pancreatic cancer diagnosis new_celiac: Predicts new celiac disease diagnosis new_lupus: Predicts new lupus diagnosis new_acutemi: Predicts new acute myocardial infarction diagnosis Medical Imaging (Multilabel Classification): chexpert: Predicts multiple chest X-ray findings simultaneously (14 possible findings CheXpert dataset)

title: BenchmarkEHRShot: Benchmark predictive tasks using EHRShot ‚Äî BenchmarkEHRShot
text: task uses clinical codes ehrshot table features. Optionally, can filter events OMOP table type using omop_tables parameter focus specific types clinical data (e.g., conditions, procedures, drugs).

BenchmarkEHRShot: Benchmark predictive tasks using EHRShot ‚Äî BenchmarkEHRShot
text: task Character. specific benchmark task run. Must one : Operational outcomes: "guo_los", "guo_readmission", "guo_icu" Lab values: "lab_thrombocytopenia", "lab_hyperkalemia", "lab_hypoglycemia", "lab_hyponatremia", "lab_anemia" New diagnoses: "new_hypertension", "new_hyperlipidemia", "new_pancan", "new_celiac", "new_lupus", "new_acutemi" Medical imaging: "chexpert" omop_tables Optional character vector. Names OMOP tables filter input events. specified, events ehrshot matching omop_table values included features. Common values include: "condition_occurrence", "procedure_occurrence", "drug_exposure", "measurement", "observation". max_seq_length Integer. Maximum sequence length clinical codes. Sequences longer truncated recent codes. Default 2000. Set NULL limit (recommended large datasets).

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(RHealth)  # Example 1: Binary classification task (operational outcome) dataset <- EHRShotDataset$new(   root = "/path/to/ehrshot",   tables = c("ehrshot", "splits", "guo_los"),   dev = TRUE ) task <- BenchmarkEHRShot$new(task = "guo_los") samples <- dataset$set_task(task = task)  # Example 2: Multiclass classification task (lab values) dataset <- EHRShotDataset$new(   root = "/path/to/ehrshot",   tables = c("ehrshot", "splits", "lab_thrombocytopenia"),   dev = TRUE ) task <- BenchmarkEHRShot$new(task = "lab_thrombocytopenia") samples <- dataset$set_task(task = task)  # Example 3: Multilabel classification task (medical imaging) dataset <- EHRShotDataset$new(   root = "/path/to/ehrshot",   tables = c("ehrshot", "splits", "chexpert"),   dev = FALSE ) task <- BenchmarkEHRShot$new(task = "chexpert") samples <- dataset$set_task(task = task)  # Example 4: Filter by specific OMOP tables task <- BenchmarkEHRShot$new(   task = "new_hypertension",   omop_tables = c("condition_occurrence", "drug_exposure") ) samples <- dataset$set_task(task = task) } # }   ## ------------------------------------------------ ## Method `BenchmarkEHRShot$new` ## ------------------------------------------------  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic task initialization task <- BenchmarkEHRShot$new(task = "guo_los")  # With OMOP table filtering task <- BenchmarkEHRShot$new(   task = "new_hypertension",   omop_tables = c("condition_occurrence", "drug_exposure") )  # With custom max sequence length task <- BenchmarkEHRShot$new(task = "guo_los", max_seq_length = 5000) } # }

text: EHRShot benchmark provides standardized evaluation across multiple clinical prediction tasks: Operational Outcomes: guo_los: Length stay prediction guo_readmission: Hospital readmission prediction guo_icu: ICU admission prediction Lab Values: lab_thrombocytopenia: Low platelet count prediction lab_hyperkalemia: High potassium level prediction lab_hypoglycemia: Low blood sugar prediction lab_hyponatremia: Low sodium level prediction lab_anemia: Anemia prediction New Diagnoses: new_hypertension: New hypertension diagnosis new_hyperlipidemia: New hyperlipidemia diagnosis new_pancan: New pancreatic cancer diagnosis new_celiac: New celiac disease diagnosis new_lupus: New lupus diagnosis new_acutemi: New acute myocardial infarction diagnosis Medical Imaging: chexpert: CheXpert multi-label chest X-ray finding classification

title: EHRShotDataset: Dataset class for EHRShot Benchmark ‚Äî EHRShotDataset
text: root Character. Root directory EHRShot dataset containing CSV files (e.g., ehrshot.csv, splits.csv, task label files). tables Character vector tables include. include minimum "ehrshot" events "splits" data splitting. Additional task-specific label tables can added (e.g., "guo_los", "lab_thrombocytopenia"). Available task tables include: Operational outcomes: "guo_los", "guo_readmission", "guo_icu" Lab values: "lab_thrombocytopenia", "lab_hyperkalemia", "lab_hypoglycemia", "lab_hyponatremia", "lab_anemia" New diagnoses: "new_hypertension", "new_hyperlipidemia", "new_pancan", "new_celiac", "new_lupus", "new_acutemi" Imaging: "chexpert" dataset_name Character. Optional custom name dataset. Defaults "ehrshot". config_path Character. Optional path custom YAML configuration file. NULL (default), uses built-EHRShot configuration. dev Logical. TRUE, limits data loading 1000 patients rapid prototyping testing. Default FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed BaseDataset$initialize.

title: MortalityPredictionEICU Task ‚Äî MortalityPredictionEICU
text: Task predicting ICU mortality using eICU-CRD dataset. Predicts whether patient die ICU stay based clinical information collected stay.

title: MortalityPredictionEICU Task ‚Äî MortalityPredictionEICU
text: task uses unit discharge status patient table determine mortality. prediction based clinical codes diagnosis, physicalExam (procedures), medication tables. Label definition: Label = 1 unitdischargestatus == "Expired" Label = 0 otherwise task excludes: ICU stays without clinical codes (conditions, procedures, drugs) Features: conditions: ICD-9 codes diagnosis table procedures: Physical examination paths physicalexam table drugs: Drug names medication table

E.g., setting num_layers=2 mean stacking two GRUs together form stacked GRU, second GRU taking outputs first GRU computing final results. Default: 1 dropout non-zero, introduces Dropout layer outputs GRU layer except last layer, dropout probability equal dropout. Default: 0 bidirectional TRUE, becomes bidirectional GRU. Default: FALSE

title: RNNLayer Class ‚Äî RNNLayer
text: Key design points Accepts mask indicating valid time steps (1‚Äëbased indexing respected). Uses pack_padded_sequence + pad_packed_sequence efficiency. Samples whose sequence length zero (‚Äëzero rows) skipped RNN computation later filled learnable parameter null_hidden downstream layers always receive hidden vector. Works unidirectional bidirectional networks. bidirectional case, last hidden state built forward last step backward first step, projected back hidden_size.

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(torch) library(lubridate)  # Create training samples with timeseries data train_samples <- list(   list(     patient_id = 1,     labs = list(       timestamps = as.POSIXct(c("2020-01-01 00:00:00", "2020-01-01 02:00:00"), tz = "UTC"),       values = matrix(c(100, 50, 150, 60), ncol = 2)     )   ),   list(     patient_id = 2,     labs = list(       timestamps = as.POSIXct(c("2020-01-01 00:00:00", "2020-01-01 01:00:00"), tz = "UTC"),       values = matrix(c(120, 55, 180, 65), ncol = 2)     )   ) )  # Example 1: Default behavior (with normalization) processor <- TimeseriesProcessor$new(   sampling_rate = dhours(1),   impute_strategy = "forward_fill"   # normalize = TRUE by default )  # Fit on training data to compute statistics processor$fit(train_samples, "labs")  # Process samples (applies normalization) result <- processor$process(train_samples[[1]]$labs)  # Check normalization statistics print(processor$feature_means)  # Feature means from training data print(processor$feature_stds)   # Feature standard deviations  # Example 2: Disable normalization if needed processor_no_norm <- TimeseriesProcessor$new(   sampling_rate = dhours(1),   impute_strategy = "forward_fill",   normalize = FALSE  # Explicitly disable normalization ) result_no_norm <- processor_no_norm$process(train_samples[[1]]$labs) } # }

title: Multiclass Classification Metrics ‚Äî multiclass_metrics_fn
text: configurable evaluator multiclass classification tasks.  function reproduces behaviour Python's multiclass_metrics_fn, covering classical discrimination metrics (ROC‚ÄëAUC various averaging strategies, F1, accuracy, ‚Ä¶) well calibration metrics (ECE / adaptive ECE / classwise ECE). Supported metrics names: "roc_auc_macro_ovo" ‚Äì ROC AUC, macro averaged one-vs-one "roc_auc_macro_ovr" ‚Äì ROC AUC, macro averaged one-vs-rest "roc_auc_weighted_ovo" ‚Äì ROC AUC, weighted averaged one-vs-one "roc_auc_weighted_ovr" ‚Äì ROC AUC, weighted averaged one-vs-rest "accuracy" ‚Äì Overall accuracy "balanced_accuracy" ‚Äì Balanced accuracy (useful imbalanced datasets) "f1_micro" ‚Äì F1 score, micro averaged "f1_macro" ‚Äì F1 score, macro averaged "f1_weighted" ‚Äì F1 score, weighted averaged "jaccard_micro" ‚Äì Jaccard index, micro averaged "jaccard_macro" ‚Äì Jaccard index, macro averaged "jaccard_weighted" ‚Äì Jaccard index, weighted averaged "cohen_kappa" ‚Äì Cohen's Œ∫ "brier_top1" ‚Äì Brier score top prediction true label "ECE" ‚Äì Expected Calibration Error (equal‚Äëwidth bins) "ECE_adapt" ‚Äì Adaptive ECE (equal‚Äësize bins) "cwECEt" ‚Äì Classwise ECE threshold "cwECEt_adapt" ‚Äì Classwise adaptive ECE threshold "hits@n" ‚Äì Computes HITS@1, HITS@5, HITS@10 "mean_rank" ‚Äì Computes mean rank mean reciprocal rank

title: Multiclass Classification Metrics ‚Äî multiclass_metrics_fn
code: multiclass_metrics_fn(y_true, y_prob, metrics = NULL, y_predset = NULL)

title: Multiclass Classification Metrics ‚Äî multiclass_metrics_fn
text: y_true Numeric integer vector ground‚Äëtruth labels (1, 2, ..., K) using R's 1-based indexing. y_prob Numeric matrix predicted probabilities shape (n_samples, n_classes). metrics Character vector listing metrics compute.  Default c("accuracy", "f1_macro", "f1_micro"). y_predset Optional matrix prediction set metrics. Default NULL.

title: Multiclass Classification Metrics ‚Äî multiclass_metrics_fn
text: Named numeric vector one element per requested metric.

title: Multiclass Classification Metrics ‚Äî multiclass_metrics_fn
code: set.seed(42) n <- 100 k <- 4 y_true <- sample(1:k, n, replace = TRUE) y_prob <- matrix(runif(n * k), nrow = n, ncol = k) y_prob <- y_prob / rowSums(y_prob)  # normalize to sum to 1 multiclass_metrics_fn(y_true, y_prob, metrics = c("accuracy", "f1_macro")) #>  accuracy  f1_macro  #> 0.2100000 0.2047787

title: Multilabel Classification Metrics ‚Äî multilabel_metrics_fn
text: configurable evaluator multilabel classification tasks, sample can belong multiple classes simultaneously. function computes various discrimination metrics commonly used multilabel problems. Supported metrics names: "accuracy" ‚Äì Subset accuracy (exact match ratio) "hamming_loss" ‚Äì Hamming loss (fraction incorrect labels) "f1_micro" ‚Äì F1 score, micro averaged across labels "f1_macro" ‚Äì F1 score, macro averaged across labels "f1_weighted" ‚Äì F1 score, weighted averaged label support "f1_samples" ‚Äì F1 score, averaged across samples "precision_micro" ‚Äì Precision, micro averaged "precision_macro" ‚Äì Precision, macro averaged "precision_weighted" ‚Äì Precision, weighted averaged "precision_samples" ‚Äì Precision, averaged across samples "recall_micro" ‚Äì Recall, micro averaged "recall_macro" ‚Äì Recall, macro averaged "recall_weighted" ‚Äì Recall, weighted averaged "recall_samples" ‚Äì Recall, averaged across samples "jaccard_micro" ‚Äì Jaccard index, micro averaged "jaccard_macro" ‚Äì Jaccard index, macro averaged "jaccard_weighted" ‚Äì Jaccard index, weighted averaged "jaccard_samples" ‚Äì Jaccard index, averaged across samples "roc_auc_micro" ‚Äì ROC AUC, micro averaged (requires y_prob) "roc_auc_macro" ‚Äì ROC AUC, macro averaged (requires y_prob) "roc_auc_weighted" ‚Äì ROC AUC, weighted averaged (requires y_prob) "roc_auc_samples" ‚Äì ROC AUC, averaged across samples (requires y_prob) "pr_auc_micro" ‚Äì PR AUC, micro averaged (requires y_prob) "pr_auc_macro" ‚Äì PR AUC, macro averaged (requires y_prob) "pr_auc_weighted" ‚Äì PR AUC, weighted averaged (requires y_prob) "pr_auc_samples" ‚Äì PR AUC, averaged across samples (requires y_prob)

title: Multilabel Classification Metrics ‚Äî multilabel_metrics_fn
text: y_true Binary matrix data frame ground‚Äëtruth labels shape (n_samples, n_labels), 1 indicates presence 0 indicates absence. y_prob Numeric matrix predicted probabilities shape (n_samples, n_labels). converted binary predictions using threshold. metrics Character vector listing metrics compute.  Default c("accuracy", "f1_micro", "f1_macro"). threshold Numeric threshold converting probabilities binary predictions. Default 0.5.

title: Multilabel Classification Metrics ‚Äî multilabel_metrics_fn
text: Named numeric vector one element per requested metric.

title: Multilabel Classification Metrics ‚Äî multilabel_metrics_fn
code: set.seed(42) n <- 100 k <- 5 y_true <- matrix(rbinom(n * k, 1, 0.3), nrow = n, ncol = k) y_prob <- matrix(runif(n * k), nrow = n, ncol = k) multilabel_metrics_fn(y_true, y_prob, metrics = c("accuracy", "f1_micro")) #>  accuracy  f1_micro  #> 0.0400000 0.3264249

title: Regression Metrics ‚Äî regression_metrics_fn
text: configurable evaluator regression tasks. function computes various regression metrics, particularly useful reconstruction tasks (e.g., autoencoders). Reproduces behaviour Python's regression_metrics_fn. Supported metrics names: "kl_divergence" ‚Äì Kullback-Leibler divergence "mse" ‚Äì Mean Squared Error "mae" ‚Äì Mean Absolute Error

title: Regression Metrics ‚Äî regression_metrics_fn
text: x Numeric vector, matrix, torch tensor true target data sample. x_rec Numeric vector, matrix, torch tensor reconstructed data sample. metrics Character vector listing metrics compute.  Default c("kl_divergence", "mse", "mae").

title: Regression Metrics ‚Äî regression_metrics_fn
text: Named numeric vector one element per requested metric.

title: Regression Metrics ‚Äî regression_metrics_fn
code: set.seed(42) x <- runif(1000) x_rec <- runif(1000) regression_metrics_fn(x, x_rec, metrics = c("mse", "mae")) #>       mse       mae  #> 0.1726048 0.3409409
